Correspondence Analysis

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/plot_ca.R, R/run_ca.R
ca.Rd

Performs a correspondence analysis.

run_ca(object, ...)

predict_ca(object, data, ...)

plot_ca(object, ...)

# S4 method for CA
plot_ca(object, axes = c(1, 2), map = c("rows", "columns"), ...)

# S4 method for BootCA
plot_ca(object, axes = c(1, 2), map = c("rows", "columns"), keep = NULL, ...)

# S4 method for CountMatrix
run_ca(object, dimensions = NULL, ...)

# S4 method for CA,CountMatrix
predict_ca(object, data, ...)

Arguments

object

A CountMatrix object.
...

Currently not used.
data

A CountMatrix object for which to predict CA coordinates.
axes

A length-two numeric vector specifying the components to plot.
map

A character vector specifying the graph to plot. It must be one or both of "rows" or "columns". Any unambiguous substring can be given.
keep

A character vector specifying the subset to plot. It must be NULL or one or both of "rows" or "columns". (see refine_ca).
dimensions

An integer value giving the number of dimensions kept in the results. If NULL (the default), all dimensions are kept.

See also

refine_ca, seriate_correspondence

Author

N. Frerebeau

Examples

## Coerce dataset to a count matrix
counts <- as_count(compiegne)

## Computes correspondence analysis
ca <- run_ca(counts)
plot_ca(ca, map = c("rows", "columns"))
